definition: demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: If you see someone Xiexing evil thoughts, how to dispose of it in the?
sentences.chinese: 如看到别人邪行邪念，该怎么来处置呢？

sentences.english: Will I even be able to fend off my demons and feel loved?
sentences.chinese: 我是否还能战胜我的邪念并且感到我是被爱着的？

sentences.english: Virtue may not always make a face handsome, but vice will certainly make it ugly.
sentences.chinese: 美德不一定能使容貌变美，邪念却必然令人变丑。

sentences.english: Who thinketh no evil, but sings?
Don't allow evil thoughts to poison young people's minds.

sentences.chinese: 牧师规戒人们勿起邪念。

sentences.english: He purified her spirit of evil thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他净化她满腹邪念的灵魂。

sentences.english: They were filled with all manner of unrighteousness, evil, covetousness, malice.
sentences.chinese: 他们态度恶劣，充满邪念，攀比，恶毒。

sentences.english: That may have been what he had in mind all along.
sentences.chinese: 也许那是他心存许久的邪念。

sentences.english: The music seems to purify one's spirit of evil thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 这种音乐似乎能够荡涤人们心灵中的邪念。

definition: to conceive a scheme/to devise a plan
